title: Calories in a Reuben Sandwich
meta_description: Learn calories in a reuben sandwich, with a full nutrition breakdown including protein, carbs, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for lighter versions.
assumptions: Standard deli Reuben: 4 oz corned beef, 2 oz Swiss cheese, 1/4 cup sauerkraut, 2 tbsp Russian dressing, 2 slices rye bread, grilled.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by deli, portion sizes, bread type, and dressing amount. Check restaurant info or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical Reuben sandwich contains about 650 calories and 35 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use turkey instead of corned beef

faqs.q: How many calories are in a Reuben sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 650 calories for a standard version.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Reuben?
faqs.a: About 35 g, mostly from corned beef and cheese.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in a Reuben?
faqs.a: Corned beef, sauerkraut, and dressing contribute to ~2000 mg per sandwich.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-calorie Reuben?
faqs.a: Yes, swap for turkey, low-fat dressing, or whole grain bread to cut 100-200 kcal.

faqs.q: Are carbs high in a Reuben sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 50 g, primarily from rye bread; fiber is about 4 g.
